high.label: High
high.description: The combination of your symptoms could indicate a serious condition that requires prompt medical evaluation.
high.advice: Monitor your symptoms closely. If they persist, worsen, or you develop new symptoms such as confusion, stiff neck, or severe nausea, seek medical attention immediately.

moderate.label: Moderate
moderate.description: Your symptoms suggest a condition that should be monitored and assessed.
moderate.advice: Rest, stay hydrated, and consult a healthcare professional if symptoms persist or worsen.

low.label: Low
low.description: Your symptoms appear mild and are often manageable at home.
low.advice: Continue monitoring your symptoms and follow general wellness practices.

high.name: Meningitis
high.description: Headache with fever and vomiting can indicate meningitis, a serious condition requiring urgent care.

high.name: Intracranial Pressure Increase
high.description: Persistent headache with vomiting may suggest increased pressure inside the skull.

moderate.name: Viral Infection (Influenza or COVID-19)
moderate.description: Common causes of headache, fever, and fatigue.

moderate.name: Bacterial Sinusitis
moderate.description: Headache and fever may indicate a sinus infection.

low.name: Tension Headache
low.description: Stress-related headaches that are usually not serious.

low.name: Common Cold
low.description: Mild symptoms such as cough or sore throat.
